intro: Cleochroma calycina, commonly known as the yellow bell heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heaths and heather. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Cleochroma calycina is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
